Description: Four joining sherds of large North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; inside glazed with incised ornamental friezes separated by bands of added red lined in white; above, large dot-rosettes alternating with sets of tongues, all with alterating red and white details; below, lotus and bud frieze with added red detail; exterior: part of three friezes separated by added red band lined in white; central, stopt maeander; above, goats grazing to left (part of four preserved); below, goat to right, looking back; added red for details.
Curator's comments: Joins1886,0401.1088, 1924,1201.963, 967 and 1031, and close to 1886,0401.993. 1924,1201.964 is from the same bowl. The inside decoration of the whole has a reserved band below the rim and white rosette alternating with triple verticals below; below that incised rosettes ands tongues, lotus and bud and more tongues towards the base. The outside, from the rim down has: short tongues; black-figure animal frieze, lion and bull preserved; stopt meander; goats to left; stop tmeander; goats to right, looking back; lotus-palmettes and buds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1155)
